Name: Cécile Ané
Summary of Research: Developing statistical methods for evolutionary biology, particularly in phylogenetics and comparative methods.
Fields of Research: Statistical Methods in Evolutionary Biology, Phylogenetics, Comparative Methods, Data Science

Name: Eric Bach
Faculty: Computer Sciences ; Electrical & Computer Engineering ; Mathematics
Summary of Research: Research focuses on theoretical computer science, computational number theory, algebraic algorithms, complexity theory, and cryptography.
Fields of Research: Theoretical Computer Science, Computational Number Theory, Algebraic Algorithms, Complexity Theory, Cryptography

Name: Richard J. Chappell
Summary of Research: Research interests include the analysis and design of clinical trials, estimation in generalized linear models, and models in radiobiology.
Fields of Research: Clinical Trials Analysis and Design, Generalized Linear Models, Survival Analysis, Alzheimer's Disease Prediction, Radiobiology Models

Name: Yongyi Guo
Summary of Research: Research includes statistical reinforcement learning, distributed learning, experimental causal inference, and high-dimensional statistics.
Fields of Research: Statistical Reinforcement Learning, Distributed Learning, Experimental Causal Inference, High-Dimensional Statistics, Healthcare Applications

Name: Bret Larget
Summary of Research: Research focuses on statistical methods in biological sciences, Bayesian computational approaches to study evolution, and data science education.
Fields of Research: Statistical Methods in Biological Sciences, Bayesian Computational Approaches, Evolutionary Studies, Data Science Education

Name: Keith Levin
Summary of Research: Research includes network analysis, dimension reduction, concentration inequalities, and clustering problems, with applications to neuroscience and speech processing.
Fields of Research: Network Analysis, Dimension Reduction, Concentration Inequalities, Clustering Problems, Neuroscience Applications, Speech Processing Applications

Name: Garvesh Raskutti
Faculty: Statistics ; Computer Sciences ; Electrical & Computer Engineering
Summary of Research: Research focuses on optimization theory, information theory, and theoretical statistics, with applications in systems biology and neuroscience.
Fields of Research: Optimization Theory, Information Theory, Theoretical Statistics, Large-Scale Inference, Systems Biology, Neuroscience

Name: Michael A. Newton
Summary of Research: Research in data science applications in biomedicine, including cancer biology, immunology, and genomics.
Fields of Research: Data Science in Biomedicine, Cancer Biology, Immunology, Genomics, High-Dimensional Biostatistical Inference, Computational Statistics, Empirical Bayesian Methods

Name: Karl Broman
Summary of Research: Research in statistical genetics, including QTL mapping and reproducible research.
Fields of Research: Statistical Genetics, QTL Mapping, Reproducible Research, Data Visualization, Scientific Communication

Name: Ronald Gangnon
Summary of Research: Research focuses on spatial epidemiology, statistical methods for observational studies, and chronic disease epidemiology.
Fields of Research: Spatial Epidemiology, Observational Studies, Chronic Disease Epidemiology, Causal Inference

Name: Aws Albarghouthi
Summary of Research: I study the art and science of program synthesis and verification. My group is currently focused on two problems: a) automatically synthesizing compilers for quantum computers and b) certifying robustness and fairness of machine learning.
Fields of Research: Program Synthesis, Program Verification, Quantum Computing, Machine Learning

Name: Kassem Fawaz
Summary of Research: I am an associate professor in the ECE Department at the University of Wisconsin - Madison, where I am also affiliated with the Computer Sciences Department. My research interests include security and privacy issues in computer systems, with a focus on machine learning security, privacy-preserving technologies, and the security of cyber-physical systems.
Fields of Research: Security and Privacy in Computer Systems, Machine Learning Security, Privacy-Preserving Technologies, Cyber-Physical Systems Security

Name: Anthony Gitter
Summary of Research: I am an assistant professor in the Department of Biostatistics & Medical Informatics at the University of Wisconsin-Madison and an affiliate faculty member in the Computer Sciences Department. My research focuses on computational biology, particularly the development of machine learning methods to understand complex biological systems and processes.
Fields of Research: Computational Biology, Machine Learning, Bioinformatics

Name: Junjie Hu
Faculty: Biostatistics & Medical Informatics ; Computer Sciences ; Data Science
Summary of Research: I am an assistant professor with appointments in the Department of Biostatistics & Medical Informatics, the Department of Computer Sciences, and the Data Science Institute at the University of Wisconsin-Madison. My research interests include natural language processing and machine learning, with a focus on building robust intelligent systems that can adapt to environmental changes and interact with people speaking different languages.
Fields of Research: Natural Language Processing, Machine Learning, Multilingual Representation Learning, Machine Learning Model Evaluation and Interpretation

Name: Tsung-Wei Huang
Summary of Research: I am an assistant professor in the Department of Electrical & Computer Engineering at the University of Wisconsin-Madison. My research interests include parallel computing, high-performance computing, and computer-aided design for very-large-scale integration (VLSI) systems.
Fields of Research: Parallel Computing, High-Performance Computing, Computer-Aided Design for VLSI Systems

Name: Bhuvana Krishnaswamy
Summary of Research: I am an assistant professor in the Department of Electrical & Computer Engineering at the University of Wisconsin-Madison and an affiliate faculty member in the Computer Sciences Department. My research focuses on wireless networking and mobile computing, with an emphasis on developing systems and protocols to improve the performance and reliability of wireless communication in diverse environments.
Fields of Research: Wireless Networking, Mobile Computing, Networked Systems Design and Implementation

Name: Kangwook Lee
Summary of Research: I am an assistant professor in the Department of Electrical & Computer Engineering at the University of Wisconsin-Madison and an affiliate faculty member in the Computer Sciences Department. My research interests include machine learning, information theory, and coding theory, with a focus on developing efficient and robust algorithms for large-scale data analysis and distributed systems.
Fields of Research: Machine Learning, Information Theory, Coding Theory, Distributed Systems

Name: Benjamin Lengerich
Summary of Research: I am an assistant professor in the Department of Statistics at the University of Wisconsin-Madison and an affiliate faculty member in the Computer Sciences Department. My research focuses on developing machine learning methods that are interpretable and reliable, with applications in scientific domains such as biology and medicine.
Fields of Research: Machine Learning, Interpretability, Reliability, Computational Biology, Biomedical Data Science

Name: Yin Li
Summary of Research: I am an assistant professor in the Department of Biostatistics & Medical Informatics at the University of Wisconsin-Madison, with an affiliate appointment in the Department of Computer Sciences. My research interests lie in computer vision and its applications in healthcare, focusing on developing novel algorithms for image and video analysis, particularly in activity recognition in natural settings.
Fields of Research: Computer Vision, Mobile Health, Machine Learning

Name: Jeffrey Linderoth
Summary of Research: I am a professor in the Department of Industrial & Systems Engineering at the University of Wisconsin-Madison and an affiliate faculty member in the Computer Sciences Department. My research focuses on mathematical optimization, particularly in developing algorithms and software for large-scale optimization problems, with applications in areas such as energy systems and transportation.
Fields of Research: Mathematical Optimization, Large-Scale Optimization, Energy Systems, Transportation

Name: Jim Luedtke
Summary of Research: I am a professor in the Department of Industrial & Systems Engineering at the University of Wisconsin-Madison and an affiliate faculty member in the Computer Sciences Department. My research interests include stochastic and robust optimization, with applications in areas such as energy systems, healthcare, and supply chain management.
Fields of Research: Stochastic Optimization, Robust Optimization, Energy Systems, Healthcare, Supply Chain Management

Name: Haley Vlach
Summary of Research: Language and cognitive development; bridging basic research on children's learning with educational settings
Fields of Research: Developmental, Cognition & Cognitive Neuroscience

Name: Katie Howell
Summary of Research: Pathways that lead to risk and resilience among families and children who have experienced potentially traumatic events, such as interpersonal violence and loss
Fields of Research: Clinical

Name: Kate Walsh
Summary of Research: sexual violence prevention and response; early interventions to prevent posttraumatic stress disorder and substance misuse; understanding and improving barriers to medical, mental health, legal and advocacy services for survivors minoritized on the basis of gender, sexual orientation, race, or disability
Fields of Research: Clinical

Name: Heather Kirkorian
Summary of Research: We study how children and families play and learn in the digital age. Specific questions in our current research include: How does parents' wellbeing relate to children's media use? What is the impact of background television on children's play and parent-child interactions? What types of educational media are most effective for early learning?
Fields of Research: Developmental

Name: James Li
Summary of Research: Our research bridges clinical and diversity science, quantitative psychology, genomics, neuroscience, and developmental psychopathology to study the causes of neurodevelopmental and externalizing conditions, features, and behaviors, including ADHD, autism, conduct, and substance use.
Fields of Research: Clinical

Name: Michael Koenigs
Summary of Research: The goal of our research is to improve mental healthcare and promote well-being for individuals who are currently or formerly incarcerated. We have a longstanding collaboration with the State of Wisconsin Department of Corrections that allows us to work with people currently incarcerated in state prisons. We also work with formerly incarcerated people in our community. Our research approach includes community engagement and clinical trials.
Fields of Research: Clinical

Name: Seth Pollak
Summary of Research: Children's understanding of emotions; child mental health, effects of stress on children's learning and development, roles of experience in children's social and emotion skill development
Fields of Research: Developmental, Clinical, Biology of Brain and Behavior, Perception, Cognition & Cognitive Neuroscience

Name: Joao Guassi Moreira
Summary of Research: adolescent development; risk-taking; emotion; emotion regulation; social decision-making; quantitative methods; social cognition
Fields of Research: Developmental, Social & Personality, Cognition & Cognitive Neuroscience

Name: Stephen Ferrigno
Summary of Research: We study the evolutionary, developmental, and cultural origins of human thought. Our focus is on how children, adults from different cultures, and animals think about numbers, sequences, objects, and logical concepts. For more information: current research projects.
Fields of Research: Developmental, Cognition & Cognitive Neuroscience, Biology of Brain and Behavior

Name: Pearl Han Li
Summary of Research: how children learn from others and develop moral beliefs across cultures
Fields of Research: Developmental

Name: Morton Ann Gernsbacher
Summary of Research: Disability as Diversity; Language Comprehension; Online Communication; Open Science
Fields of Research: Cognition & Cognitive Neuroscience

Name: Sarah Short
Faculty: Educational Psych; Center for Healthy Minds; Psych
Summary of Research: Our longitudinal study examines the link between poverty, brain development and the emergence of executive functions. Data collection for this study began prenatally, with multiple study visits until children are 5yrs old. Data sets include MRI, behavioral, cognitive, biological, environmental measures. A central aim of this study is to investigate critical experiences of the home environment, including language exposure, caregiver behavior, and child sleep hygiene that may mediate the impact of poverty on children's cognitive, behavioral, and neural development
Fields of Research: Developmental, Biology of Brain and Behavior, Cognition & Cognitive Neuroscience

Name: Martha Alibali
Summary of Research: Cognitive Development; Gesture; Mathematics and Science Education
Fields of Research: Developmental, Cognition & Cognitive Neuroscience

Name: Markus Brauer
Summary of Research: Diversity and inclusion (specifically: behavior change related to promoting inclusive behaviors), sustainability
Fields of Research: Social & Personality

Name: Dan Grupe
Summary of Research: Community-engaged research on mental health and the criminal legal system, including mindfulness-based interventions and restorative justice practices with people impacted by incarceration and police officers.
Fields of Research: Clinical

Name: Ramya Korlakai Vinayak
Faculty: Electrical & Computer Engineering ; Computer Science ; Statistics
Summary of Research: Research in Machine Learning, Statistical Inference, and Crowdsourcing, focusing on developing theoretically grounded tools for making reliable inferences from human-generated data.
Fields of Research: Machine Learning, Statistical Inference, Crowdsourcing

Name: Miguel Acosta
Summary of Research: Research in empirical macroeconomics and international trade, often using non-traditional data sources such as textual analysis and digitized historical records.
Fields of Research: Macroeconomics, International Trade

Name: Naoki Aizawa
Summary of Research: Research in public economics, health economics, and labor economics, particularly on the interaction between social insurance programs and labor markets.
Fields of Research: Public Economics, Health Economics, Labor Economics

Name: Job Boerma
Summary of Research: Research in macroeconomics and public finance, focusing on wealth inequality, taxation, and the macroeconomic implications of mental health.
Fields of Research: Macroeconomics, Public Finance

Name: Carol Eunmi Lee
Summary of Research: Research in evolutionary responses to environmental changes, focusing on biological invasions, climate change, and pollution, using copepods as model systems.
Fields of Research: Evolutionary Biology, Genetics, Genomics, Physiology, Environmental Adaptation

Name: Olaf Jensen
Summary of Research: Research in fisheries science and aquatic ecosystems, combining mathematical modeling, data synthesis, and field studies to improve conservation and management strategies.
Fields of Research: Fisheries Science, Conservation Biology, Marine Ecology, Aquatic Biology, Ecology

Name: Jesse Weber
Summary of Research: Research in evolutionary genetics, host-parasite interactions, and adaptation biology, focusing on how vertebrates coevolve with parasites.
Fields of Research: Evolutionary Genetics, Host-Parasite Interactions, Adaptation Biology

Name: Robert Johnson
Summary of Research: Research in aquatic ecosystem ecology, particularly the effects of green sea turtle herbivory and environmental stressors on seagrass ecosystems.
Fields of Research: Aquatic Ecosystem Ecology, Seagrass Ecology, Herbivory, Environmental Stressors

Name: Adam Bailey
Summary of Research: Research in viral pathogenesis, viral persistence, and zoonotic diseases, with a focus on emerging pathogens and hemorrhagic fevers.
Fields of Research: Viral Pathogenesis, Viral Persistence, Zoonosis, Infectious Diseases

Name: Donna Peters
Summary of Research: Research in molecular pathology and ocular diseases, contributing to understanding disease mechanisms and treatment strategies.
Fields of Research: Molecular Pathology, Ocular Diseases

Name: Henry Bunn
Summary of Research: My research emphasizes the evolutionary ecology of Early Pleistocene hominins, particularly the diet and foraging strategies of early Homo, and the behavioral ecology and archaeology of Hadza foragers in Tanzania. I have conducted extensive fieldwork at Olduvai Gorge, focusing on Oldowan archaeological sites, and have studied modern foraging societies to gain insights into early human behavior.
Fields of Research: Archaeology of Human Origins, Evolution of Human Diet, Foraging Strategies, East Africa

Name: Fumie Iizuka
Summary of Research: I am an archaeologist studying decisions made by hunter-gatherers and early farmers to adopt pottery and associated technology in response to climate and ecosystem changes. My work critically evaluates geochronology in these contexts, focusing on pre-ceramic to ceramic period transitions in Eastern Eurasia, including Japan, Mongolia, and Siberian Russia, as well as in Latin America.
Fields of Research: Archaeology, Eastern Eurasia, Archaeometry, Ceramics, Paleoenvironment, Hunter-Gatherers, Early Farmers, Pre-Ceramic to Ceramic Transitions, Late Pleistocene to Mid-Holocene

Name: J. Mark Kenoyer
Summary of Research: My research focuses on the archaeology of the Indus Civilization, including early urbanism, technology, trade, and socio-economic and political organization. I have been excavating and conducting research on the Indus Civilization since 1975, with significant work at the site of Harappa, Pakistan. My interests also encompass ancient technologies, crafts, and cultural periods in South Asia and other regions.
Fields of Research: Archaeology of the Indus Civilization, Origins of Technology, Craft Specialization, Ancient Trade, Early Urbanism, Socio-Economic and Political Organization, South Asia

Name: Timothy Bugni
Summary of Research: Professor Bugni's research focuses on marine natural products chemistry, aiming to discover new agents to treat multi-drug resistant infectious diseases, particularly MDR-fungal and MDR-Gram negative bacterial pathogens. His work involves developing methods to mine the metabolomes of marine bacteria for novel molecules, utilizing mass spectrometry and nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy for structure elucidation, and evaluating their potential as drug leads.
Fields of Research: Marine Natural Products Chemistry, Drug Discovery, Metabolomics, Mass Spectrometry, NMR Spectroscopy

Name: Karen B. Strier
Summary of Research: Professor Strier's research aims to understand the behavioral ecology of primates from a comparative perspective and contribute to their conservation. Since 1982, she has been studying the critically endangered northern muriqui (*Brachyteles hypoxanthus*) in Brazil's Atlantic forest, providing insights into their behavior, ecology, and conservation needs.
Fields of Research: Primate Behavioral Ecology, Conservation, Population Dynamics, Brazil's Atlantic Forest
